title: Josh Warrington promises Sofiane Takoucht "thriller" to make up for "cuddling contest"
text:

Josh Warrington is determined to deliver a fight-of-the-year contender against Sofiane Takoucht this weekend - after admitting his previous bout with Kid Galahad was a “cuddling contest”.

Warrington defends his IBF featherweight world title for the third time against the unfancied Frenchman in Leeds on Saturday night.

Last time out, the Leeds boxer edged his way to a split-decision victory after a messy and frustrating fight, which came after two mouthwatering battles with Lee Selby and Carl Frampton.

And Warrington has vowed to put on a show in front of his home support as he looks for a unification fight with one of the division’s other world champions.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

He said: “The build-up of the last fight, we took our eye off a few things because we were so concentrated on getting unification fights after Galahad.

“There have been talks about fights which potentially could happen, talks about Elland Road but this time all the focus has been on this fight.

“Now I get to showcase what we are really about. After the last fight, I want to come back with an A-class performance.

"Selby, Frampton were fights of the year but the last one was a cuddling contest. You want to have a win, but you don’t want to be having the equivalent of a 1-0 win on a cold Monday night.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

“You want to be having a thriller, dominating the game for 90 minutes. I want to be in entertaining fights and win in spectacular fashion.”

Warrington, who is unbeaten in 29, is a heavy favourite for Saturday's showdown but he insists he isn't getting complacent.

He added: “Takoucht is coming here to try to take the titles away from me, to stop want I want to achieve. If I want to entice the world champions into a big fight then I have to beat him in style.

“He can go back home being a hero, he would turn his career around. I understand how fighters get complacent, but I don’t let that happen. We are on a mission. For me to carry on that mission, I’ve got to win.”
description: Warrington defends his IBF featherweight world title for the third time against the unfancied Frenchman in Leeds on Saturday night
